book.title: Dinámicas de adaptación del narcotráfico marítimo y la ciudad puerto : análisis y respuestas al problema

results.title: Respuestas a la corrupción asociada al crimen organizado transnacional desde la regulación del estatuto de los puertos en el derecho internacional marítimo

abstracts.content: The purpose of this article is to analyze the operation and organization of ports in international maritime law, especially considering the prevention of corruption and the fight against transnational organized crime groups. Therefore, in the first part of the article, the concept of ports characterized by various ownership models (public ownership, private ownership, and hybrid-mixed ownership) is analyzed in the light of a strong movement toward their privatization and liberalization in recent years, as well as the notion of "virtual enterprise". Therefore, the study addresses the aforementioned concepts, providing a theoretical basis for further analysis. In the second part of the article, the problem related to the activities of transnational organized crime groups, as well as the responses of the international community against this problem are presented. The international instruments adopted by the International Maritime Organization such as the ISPS Code, Guide on Maritime Security, as well as the IMO-ILO Code of Practice on Port Security are analyzed. The author also presents the crucial role of customs and the Port State Control in the mentioned context. Finally, the article supports the presented analysis with a Mexican case study and the 2021 reform of the transfer of the maritime administration from civil to military jurisdiction with the main objective of combating the problem of corruption therein. In conclusion, the recommendations for the Colombian case are made to improve the situation in the ports related both to the operation of transnational organized crime groups, as well as corruption therein.

results.title: Diagnostyka

affiliations.name: Uniwersytet im. Adama Mickiewicza w Poznaniu

results.title: A mestiçagem como conceito histórico

abstracts.content: <jats:p>Além de um conceito central nas discussões sobre raça e identidade no Brasil, a mestiçagem ocupa um lugar privilegiado na tradição intelectual brasileira desde pelo menos meados do século XIX. Muitos intelectuais notaram a centralidade da mestiçagem e produziram investigações críticas sobre as implicações sociais do conceito, destacando sua função de escamotear a violência das relações raciais na história brasileira. Autores como o antropólogo Renato Ortiz e, mais recentemente, o sociólogo e ensaísta Jessé Souza denunciaram a permanência silenciosa dessa e de outras categorias com forte teor racial na tradição intelectual brasileira mesmo depois do declínio do racismo científico. No entanto, são poucos os trabalhos que se ocuparam em descrever o funcionamento desse conceito enquanto categoria analítica. Nesse artigo, buscamos descrever formalmente a mecânica do conceito de mestiçagem a partir de sua caracterização como conceito essencialmente histórico. Primeiramente definiremos a mestiçagem etimologicamente e semanticamente a partir de suas especificidades culturais e de suas diferenças em relação a outras categorias formais que designam o fenômeno do hibridismo, como miscigenação e hibridação. Em seguida, aproximamos a mestiçagem das ideias de origem e processualidade, que conferem a ela sua qualidade essencialmente histórica e que determinam seu funcionamento como categoria analítica ou conceito teórico. Por fim, discorremos brevemente sobre sua centralidade no pensamento histórico brasileiro, centralidade esta relacionada ao uso do conceito de mestiçagem para descrever fenômenos históricos ambíguos, paradoxais e dialéticos.</jats:p>

book.title: Tradycje śląskiej kultury muzycznej. T. 16

publisher.name: Akademia Muzyczna im. Karola Lipińskiego we Wrocławiu

results.title: Dialogue of cultures : the cult of Beethoven in Upper Silesia from the end of the 19th century till 1939

abstracts.content: Obecność muzyki Beethovena w głównych miastach Górnego Śląska (Katowice, Chorzów, Bytom, Zabrze, Gliwice) datuje się od schyłku XIX wieku, kiedy w tym młodym, typowo robotniczym regionie zaczęła się tworzyć warstwa inteligencji. Dzieła kameralne Beethovena zaczęły wówczas funkcjonować jako element powszechnego repertuaru szkolnego i domowego. Powstały także towarzystwa śpiewacze - polskie i niemieckie. Ważnym elementem ich działalności było celebrowanie rozmaitych świąt i rocznic. Przy tej okazji zarówno polskie, jak i niemieckie zespoły wykonywały często "IX Symfonię" i "Missa solemnis" Beethovena. Celem artykułu jest stworzenie kroniki tych wykonań oraz odtworzenie, na podstawie analizy zachowanych dokumentów (źródeł prasowych, listów, wspomnień), mechanizmu tworzenia się kultu Beethovena na styku obu rozwijających się na Górnym Śląsku kultur.

The presence of Beethoven’s music in the main cities of Upper Silesia (Katowice, Chorzów, Bytom, Zabrze, Gliwice) dates back to the end of the 19th century, when in this young, typically working-class region, the intelligentsia began to form. Beethoven's chamber works became then a part of the common school and home repertoire. There were also Polish and German singing societies organised. An important element of their activities was the celebration of various festivities. On those occasions, both Polish and German groups often performed Beethovens "Symphony No. 9" and "Missa solemnis". The aim of the article is to make a chronicle of these performances and to describe, on the basis of the analysis of preserved documents (press sources, letters, memories), the mechanism of the formation of the Beethoven cult at the meeting point of both cultures developing in Upper Silesia.

book.title: Narratives of loss and longing : literary developments in postcolonial South Asia

results.title: "The Bridge of Words" : post-partition reflection in contemporary urdu writing from Pakistan

abstracts.content: This chapter discusses the question of identity in Pakistan in the light of the difficult experience of Partition, with reference to modern Urdu literature. It argues that the division of the subcontinent, which resulted in the creation of modern states, brought a change not only in the socio-political scenario but also in cultural and literary tradition, the case of Urdu being here an example. Attempts to create a definition of what it means to be a Pakistani, against the colonial and precolonial common past, led to tensions and conflicts based on exclusivism and inequalities. The aim here is to address the main problems of modern society and its citizens against concepts such as nation, freedom, equality, and individuality – and to show how these issues have been framed into text. Urdu literature, as observed here, has a long history of dissent; hence, the critical writing here can be perceived as a continuation of the literary tradition, on one side, and as an effort to construct their own poetic language to voice their fears and struggles, on the other.

results.title: Creating an enemy as a feature of ideological discourse : the case of contemporary Russian power in relation to Ukraine

abstracts.content: Niniejszy artykuł ukazuje środki językowe, jakie stosuje W. Putin dla kreowania wrogów we współczesnych przywódcach Ukrainy. Środki te są jednoznacznie oceniające i wartościujące, mają negatywny wydźwięk, opierają się na obrazowych metaforach. Figura wroga jest rozpatrywana jako nierozłączny element ideologii, w założenia której wpisana jest imperialna ekspansja. Imperialistyczne zapędy są obserwowane w przypadku polityki prowadzonej przez rosyjskiego prezydenta, a tworzenie obrazu nieprzyjaciół służy propagandowemu objaśnianiu obywatelom przyczyn rozpoczęcia działań wojennych wobec Ukrainy. Jako materiał do analizy posłużyły wszystkie publiczne wypowiedzi W. Putina w okresie od pierwszego stycznia 2021 roku do pierwszego stycznia 2023 roku, które są zamieszczone na oficjalnym internetowym portalu Urzędu Prezydenta Federacji Rosyjskiej. Badanie zostało przeprowadzone w oparciu o krytyczną analizę dyskursu (KAD), a dokładniej w oparciu o jedno z podejść w tym nurcie badań, jaki stanowi the discourse-historical approach (DHA). Praca jest podzielona na sześć części, na które składają się: 1) wstęp, 2) wskazanie metodologii, 3) zwięzłe przedstawienie etapów kariery W. Putina, opis teraźniejszego systemu politycznego w Rosji wraz z nakreśleniem ideologii prezydenta, 4) charakterystyka figury wroga w propagandzie komunistycznej, 5) analiza języka W. Putina kreującego wrogów oraz z 6) wnioski.

This paper shows the linguistic means used by Vladimir Putin to create enemies out of the contemporary leaders of Ukraine. These means are unambiguously evaluative, have negative connotations, and are based on vivid metaphors. The figure of enemy is considered as an inseparable element of ideology, whose tenets include imperial expansion. The policies of the Russian president clearly demonstrate imperialist tendencies and his constructing of enemy images is used for propaganda purposes to explain to citizens the reasons for initiating hostilities against Ukraine. The materials used in the analysis are selections from all of Putin’s public statements delivered between 1 January 2021 and 1 January 2023, which are posted on the official website of the Office of the President of the Russian Federation. The study was conducted within the critical discourse analysis (CDA) framework by using the tools of one of its particular approaches, i.e. discourse-historical approach (DHA). The chapter is divided into six parts, which consist of: 1) introduction, 2) methodological clarifications, 3) a concise presentation of the stages of Putin's career and a description of the current political system in Russia along with an outline of the president's ideology, 4) characterization of the enemy figure in communist propaganda, 5) the analysis of Putin's enemy creating language and 6) conclusions.

book.title: Archeologicke vyskumy a nalezy na Slovensku za rok 2019

results.title: Prva etapa interdisciplinarneho vyskumu jaskyne Hučiva diera v Belianskych Tatrach

abstracts.content: S. Vysoké Tatry-Tatranská kotlina and Tatranská Lomnica (Pop-rad district), Hučivá diera cave, excavation for scientific and documentation purposes, Late Paleolithic (Magdalenian culture), Late Medieval Age/Modern period (16th century), 20 th century (WWII.). Finds de - posited at: Institute of Archaeology of SAS, Nitra. Hučivá diera cave (937 m a. s. l.) is situated on the southern slope of Kobylí vrch hill (1109 m a. s. l.), near the source of Šumivý prameň spring (Rausch Quelle), less than a kilometre south of Belianska jaskyňa cave open to tourists (Fig. 47: 1, 2). It is 16 km long, of the corrosion genetic type and created in a crack or fault in the dark Guttenstein limestones from the Middle Triassic period. The interdisciplinary excavation was carried out in the rear part of the cave (trench 1) and under the entrance portal, where a lockable metal grid was later installed. In trench 1, in superposition with finds from WWII and the 16th century, a sunken hearth was documented. It contained numerous finds which can be classified in the Magdalenian culture (Fig. 48: 2). There is also distinct chipped lithic industry from radiolarite, Polish flints, unidentified patinated raw material, rarely from limnosilicite. In terms of typology, there are blades with or without retouch, blades with diagonal distal retouch, less frequently burins and rarely end-scrapers. Schouldered points (Kerbspitze in German) and massive triangles (Fig. 48:3, 4) are typologically distinct and specific. Associated finds from the hearth contain numerous animal bones, a bone needle (Fig. 48: 6), miniature pieces of ochre pigment. Acccording to the radiocarbon analysis of the charcoals from the hearth, the settlement is dated to the Late Magdalenian, around 12,150 BC, which indicates the periods of bølling to alleröd. Hunters focused mainly on Alpine ibex (Capra ibex), which was documented in the territory of the High Tatras for the first time. Besides, bones of brown bear, wild horse (Fig. 48: 5), big game or small rodents were found. The excavation is supposed to continue. To protect this rare Paleolithic monument from damage, the ntrance to the cave is closed with a metal grid. The cave also lost it status of an open cave.

book.title: Music and sound in european theatre : practices, performances, perspectives

results.title: Mixtape dramaturgy : the case of Jan Klata

abstracts.content: In her chapter, Anna R. Burzyńska applies concepts and theories derived from DJ culture to theatrical works by Polish theatre director Jan Klata. Klata likes to use expressions like ‘remix’, ‘sample’, ‘dub’, or ‘scratch’ to describe his method of work: various operations on cultural texts (theatre plays, novels, screenplays) he adapts on stage. Burzyńska argues, however, that the most inspiring reference point to his performances is a mixtape. Klata often prepares mixtapes to help him work on his performance's dramaturgy. Sometimes he uses them only during the initial phase of conceptual thinking; sometimes during the rehearsals (to help his actors get in the mood and find their rhythm); sometimes, they operate as a performance playlist. Referring to the semiotics of music and theatre, the author reflects on such matters as the components of a theatrical work (and their hierarchy or lack thereof), the problem of originality and authorship in contemporary art, as well as the question of the sender and recipient of a theatrical mixtape and the political potential of it. The analysis of Jan Klata's artistic practices is accompanied by a reflection on questions of musical meaning and music as a medium of communication.

book.title: For security and for peace : states and societies of the Baltic Sea Basin and the Russian-Ukrainian war

results.title: The role of states and international organisations in bringing war crimes to account in the context of the Russian-Ukrainian war : from documenting crimes to trying war criminals

abstracts.content: On 24 February 2022, the authorities of the Russian Federation (RF) launched hostilities against its neighbour. Since the start of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, numerous instances of policies aimed at destroying civilian infrastructure, including critical facilities, have been observed. Consequently, it can be asserted that the actions perpetrated in the theatre of war exhibit characteristics indicative of genocide, crimes against humanity and war crimes. A separate international crime witnessed in Russia’s invasion of Ukraine is the crime of aggression, which had been added to the catalogue of war crimes towards the end of the 20th century. This chapter aims to achieve the following objectives: (1) operationalise the fundamental concepts related to the international crimes committed by the RF; (2) attempt to outline the extent of the violations committed, both quantitatively and qualitatively; (3) discuss the mechanisms of the multi-level system for documenting international crimes and the measures undertaken for their prosecution, including an overview of the status of investigations initiated before international courts; (4) and evaluate the prospects for establishing a new ad hoc tribunal to adjudicate crimes of aggression.

book.title: European theatre migrants in the age of empire : personal experiences, transnational trajectories, and socio-political impacts

results.title: ‘True-born emigrants' : the predicament of actors on nineteenth-century Polish stage in the context of migration

abstracts.content: This chapter is an attempt to show the complex situation of actors working within the partitioned Polish territories in the second half of the nineteenth century. The author is not interested in the movement of theatre people across the partitions as such, but in what was associated with and sometimes even preceded and conditioned this movement: the complicated legal and civic status of the actors, and the fluid, multi-layered self-identification of these artists as potential emigrants. Various examples are presented to illustrate aspects of this phenomenon, including the incompatibility of passport designations, the legal difficulties of impoverished actors in changing their place of residence, the language skills of people living in the Polish diaspora, and the everyday experience of border controls between Austria and Russia. A new concept of submigration (psychological migration, a strategy of operating between a number of languages, forms of belonging, and cultures) is added to existing categories such as transnational migration and internal migration.

results.title: Pozycja prawna wspólnika lub akcjonariusza spółki handlowej a status konsumenta : analiza z uwzględnieniem koncepcji prezentowanych na tle prawa niemieckiego i austriackiego

abstracts.content: Commercial law, as a branch of law regulating social relations between professionals, has axiology and genotype that is different from consumer law, which focuses on the protection of transactionally weaker subjects of civil law. Nevertheless, because of the far-reaching expansion of consumer protection to other relations, there is a junction between these two separate parts of civil law. The paper provides the results of the analysis concerning the possibility of applying consumer protection regulations to natural persons who are partners or shareholders in commercial companies. The author considered several situations of the possible application of that protection. The first two situations relate to participation in a company and acquiring a legal status of a partner or a shareholder. The third and the fourth connect to legal transactions with entities other than the parent company but with different details. The last one pertains to transactions with the parent company unrelated to the company's relationship. The paper also contains the examination of the legal status of partners and shareholders in situations when they lack consumer protection. The analysis involved a dogmatic and comparative approach with Austrian and German law, as well as cases of the European Court of Justice and theoretical studies on company law from the United Kingdom and the United States.

book.title: Cultural heritage on the urban peripheries : towards new research paradigms

results.title: Beyond ville and cite : the trajectories of the community-based revitalization of the peripheral heritage of Nowa Huta (Poland)

abstracts.content: This chapter explores the trajectories of community-based heritage revitalization in the comprehensively planned utopian socialist city of Nowa Huta, Krakow. For decades regarded as a model example of socialist realist urban planning, this district started to be marginalized after the political transformation and de-industrialization process that took place in the 1990s. Recently, it has become a center for grassroots initiatives and is becoming increasingly gentrified which is leading to new tensions. Among the various challenges that Nowa Huta is facing is that the strong local identity resulting from the identification with the neighborhood’s heritage is being subject to a process of fragmentation because of the influx of new residents and local and national policies. Local leaders actively engage in place-making processes to create fine-grain human places that people value as an experience. The presentation of the case study of the regeneration of Roses Avenue – a centrally located square that functions as the most representative public space of the district – is based on the on-going ethnographic research.

book.title: Democracy and Its Enemies in Europe : successes and Failures in Combating Autocratic Threats

results.title: Russia's political deep structures as the inherent enemy of democracy : chronicle of a death foretold in terms of systems analysis

abstracts.content: Russian history abounds in transformations, which do not necessarily meet Easton’s model of systemic change. At first sight, essential changes are associated with demolition rather than reconstruction. Any challenging input is associated with the threat of a socially costly attempt to build an essentially different system instead of brushing up the old one via a systemic conversion. That is why the memory of the revolutions of 1905 and 1917 made the new demands and proposals in the years after 1985 look like a fearful pale horse of the Apocalypse rather than a call for a gradual adjustment to Western liberal standards. The oversensitivity characterising the political apparatus and society led to the construction of a neo-conservative reaction model, which, paradoxically, led to a change where democracy and the idea of the rule of law were too fragile to be retained. However, the system of control and oppression revealed the durability of the “old armour.”Russian history abounds in transformations, which do not necessarily meet Easton’s model of systemic change. At first sight, essential changes are associated with demolition rather than reconstruction. Any challenging input is associated with the threat of a socially costly attempt to build an essentially different system instead of brushing up the old one via a systemic conversion. That is why the memory of the revolutions of 1905 and 1917 made the new demands and proposals in the years after 1985 look like a fearful pale horse of the Apocalypse rather than a call for a gradual adjustment to Western liberal standards. The oversensitivity characterising the political apparatus and society led to the construction of a neo-conservative reaction model, which, paradoxically, led to a change where democracy and the idea of the rule of law were too fragile to be retained. However, the system of control and oppression revealed the durability of the “old armour.”

book.title: Rights in criminal law : studies on a new paradigm in criminal law and procedure

results.title: Reconciliation as a sufficient response to crime

abstracts.content: Czy pojednanie może stanowić jedyną reakcję na popełnione przestępstwo? Istnieją dobre powody, by na tak postawione pytanie odpowiedzieć twierdząco, stawiając jako punkt wyjścia prawo pokrzywdzonego do decydowania o swoim życiu osobistym. Autor wskazuje argumenty oraz kontrargumenty (które pojawiły się przy okazji wprowadzenia do polskiego Kodeksu karnego art. 59a), a następnie - opierając się o modele kryminalizacyjne (liberalny, paternalistyczny, wspólnotowy) - przedstawia pojednanie jako taki czynnik pojawiający się po dokonaniu czynu, który może w niektórych przypadkach usunąć potrzebę ukarania.

Can reconciliation be the sufficent response to a crime committed? There are good reasons to answer this question in the affirmative, taking as a starting point the victim's right to decide about his or her personal life. The author identifies arguments as well as counter-arguments (which emerged on the occasion of the introduction of Article 59a into the Polish Penal Code) and then, based on the models of criminalisation (liberal, paternalistic, communitarian), presents reconciliation as such a factor emerging after the commission of the act, which may in some cases remove the need for punishment.

results.title: Spotkanie z płótnem Pietera Bruegla "Pejzaż z upadkiem Ikara" : studium detalu

abstracts.content: Artykuł został poświęcony refleksji nad klasycznym motywem i jego późniejszymi odniesieniami jako relacji świata literatury i sztuki w międzypokoleniowym spotkaniu z płótnem Pietera Bruegla "Pejzaż z upadkiem Ikara". Spotyka je bowiem nie tylko poeta W.H. Auden ("Musée des Beaux Arts"), ale także każde następne pokolenie, w tym my (akademicy) i nasi studenci (przyszli nauczyciele języka polskiego), obcujące z dziełem niderlandzkiego malarza. W wystąpieniu znajdzie się m. in. miejsce na relację doświadczenia wyniesionego z zajęć ze studentami polonistyki przygotowujących się do pracy w zawodzie nauczyciela. Co wynikło z tego spotkania? Jakie elementy okazały się kluczowe? W jaki sposób udało się wypełnić to spotkanie? Pomocna okazała się hermeneutyczny sposób patrzenia na artefakt i próba odpowiedzi na podstawowe pytania, wynikające z obcowania z dziełem. To swoiste podążanie od obrazu do tekstu, a także od tekstu do obrazu i stykanie rozmaitych stanowisk. Relacja obrazu  (jego detale) i tekstu poetyckiego (W. H. Auden) otwierają możliwość stworzenia narracji, wynikającej z własnego doświadczenia odbiorczego. M. in. aby odkryć manierę malarską Bruegla, trzeba wyjść poza płótno - w świat i przenieść wzrok na inne obrazy artysty. Relacja "ja" wobec świata będzie na tyle znacząca, aby zarejestrować głębię dialogu o ludzkiej egzystencji.  Dzięki temu istotne będzie dojście do wnioski na podstawie odpowiedzi na pytanie o to, dlaczego to tak żywotny motyw? Czego w zasadzie poszukują artyści i odbiorcy? A także, co mówią dalsze odniesienia i konteksty kulturowe o egzystencjalnej kondycji kolejnych pokoleń artystów i odbiorców?

The article is devoted to reflection on the classical motif and its later references as a relationship between the worlds of literature and art in an intergenerational encounter with Pieter Bruegel's canvas "Landscape with the Fall of Icarus". It is encountered not only by the poet W.H. Auden ("Musée des Beaux Arts"), but also by each subsequent generation, including us (academics) and our students (future teachers of Polish), who come into contact with the work of the Dutch painter. The presentation will include, among other things, a report on the experience gained from classes with students of Polish studies preparing for work as teachers. What resulted from this meeting? What elements turned out to be crucial? How was it possible to fill this meeting? The hermeneutic way of looking at the artifact and an attempt to answer basic questions resulting from contact with the work proved helpful. This is a specific movement from image to text, and also from text to image, and the meeting of various positions. The relationship between the painting (its details) and the poetic text (W. H. Auden) opens up the possibility of creating a narrative resulting from one's own experience of reception. Among other things, in order to discover Bruegel's painting manner, one must go beyond the canvas - into the world and shift one's gaze to other paintings by the artist. The relationship of the "I" to the world will be significant enough to register the depth of the dialogue about human existence. Thanks to this, it will be important to reach conclusions based on the answer to the question of why is this such a vital motif? What are artists and recipients actually looking for? And also, what do further references and cultural contexts say about the existential condition of subsequent generations of artists and recipients?

book.title: Constitutionalization of politics in comparative perspective

results.title: U.S. presidents as active interpreters of the Constitution : the case of Donald Trump

abstracts.content: Although U.S. courts are mainly able to effectively interpret the Constitution, historically there have been many examples of interpretative activism undertaken by presidents. Even if the chief executives’ impact on the interpretation of the Constitution seems natural, the means by which presidents have tried to determine the meaning of the Constitution have been diverse and sometimes disputable. From the confrontation with other branches of government, through political pressures on legal advisors and the use of different channels of communication, to activities legitimized by controversial theories, chief executives have at times been leading actors in the process of the constitutionalization of politics. The chapter analyzes the most effective tools with which U.S. presidents have pursued constitutional interpretation in seeking to legitimize their policies. Apart from defining the scope of presidential impact on the constitutionalization of politics, the chapter analyzes Donald Trump’s presidency and the tools he used to legitimize his actions and policies, as well as define the “appropriate” understanding of the Constitution.

book.title: Życie rodzinne  w dyskursie  nauk o rodzinie

results.title: Polityka prorodzinna Krakowa

abstracts.content: Praca odnosi się do praktycznych aspektów polityki prorodzinnej, prowadzonej przez Kraków wobec różnych wiekowo grup społecznych. Miasto odchodzi od modelu wsparcia materialnego i finansowego, jako wyłącznej formy pomocy, na rzecz innych działań, proponowanych przez adresatów polityki prorodzinnej, w szerokich, wieloaspektowych badaniach społecznych. Współczesna metropolitarna polityka prorodzinna opiera się nie tylko na zinstytucjonalizowanych prawnie formach wsparcia, jak domy pomocy społecznej czy ośrodki wsparcia rodziny. Dzisiaj oczekuje się form mniej sformalizowanych, wspierających różnych członków rodziny, o różnych potrzebach społecznych i indywidualnych oraz umiejętnościach i ambicjach. Dużym wyzwaniem w świetle dość schematycznych i sztywnych krajowych regulacji normatywnych, konieczne jest znalezienie na poziomie miejskiego systemu normatywnego rozwiązań elastycznych, poddających normowaniu konstrukcje bardziej kierunkowane na zdiagnozowane potrzeby rodziny.

The work refers to practical aspects of the pro-family policy implemented by Krakow towards different age-related social groups. The city is moving away from the model of material and financial support as the exclusive form of assistance in favour of other activities proposed by the addressees of the pro-family policy in broad, multi-aspect social research. Contemporary metropolitan pro-family policy is based not only on legally institutionalised forms of support, such as social welfare homes or family support centres. Today, less formalised forms are expected, supporting different family members, with different social and individual needs, skills and ambitions. A major challenge in the light of the rather schematic and rigid national normative regulations is to find flexible solutions at the level of the city normative system, subjecting to standardisation structures more directed at the diagnosed needs of the family.

book.title: For security and for peace : states and societies of the Baltic Sea Basin and the Russian-Ukrainian war

results.title: Impact of the Russian-Ukrainian war on the Baltic area's economy

abstracts.content: The objective of this chapter is to analyse the economic consequences of the war in Ukraine and evaluate how these have affected the economy of the Baltic Sea states. Problems with energy security are discussed as it has been put at risk by the escalation of conflict, as well as problems with food security and investment. An assessment of important economic indicators, as well as a prognosis of potential future developments influencing the Baltic Sea states’ economies, has also been made. According to the study, there has been economic instability and a disrupted supply chain during this time, namely with regard to the food and energy, security of not only the Baltic Sea states, but also, through the transit of goods, other European countries has been at high risk. That has led to the need to divert trade and, furthermore, to shaky investor confidence in the markets of the region. For the Baltic Sea states, as for all EU countries, energy independence from Russian raw materials has become a priority goal, which has intensified efforts towards sustainable development and the implementation of the ‘Green Deal’ policy.

book.title: The Routledge handbook of sexuality in East Central Europe

results.title: Risk, responsibility, and pleasure : HIV politics in Poland

abstracts.content: W rozdziale zatytułowanym "Ryzyko, odpowiedzialność i przyjemność: Polityka HIV w Polsce" Agata Dziuban i Justyna Struzik analizują współczesną politykę seksualną w Polsce przez pryzmat wzajemnie powiązanych reżimów ryzyka i odpowiedzialności, które kształtują dyskursy i praktyki związane z HIV/AIDS. Autorki wskazują, że dominujące narracje konstruują seksualność nienormatywną jako zagrożenie dla moralnego i społecznego porządku, co prowadzi do zwiększonej kryminalizacji osób żyjących z HIV oraz marginalizacji przyjemności jako elementu zdrowia seksualnego. Na podstawie badań jakościowych, w tym wywiadów z aktywistami i analizy kampanii profilaktycznych (np. kontrowersyjnej kampanii "Seks w moim mieście"), autorki pokazują, jak konserwatywne ramy polityki seksualnej ograniczają możliwości działań organizacji pozarządowych. Wnioskują, że masowe protesty przeciwko homofobii i zaostrzeniu prawa aborcyjnego mogą otworzyć przestrzeń dla alternatywnych, afirmatywnych wizji seksualności, opartych na przyjemności i sprawczości.

In the chapter titled "Risk, Responsibility, and Pleasure: HIV Politics in Poland", Agata Dziuban and Justyna Struzik examine contemporary sexual politics in Poland through the lens of intertwined regimes of risk and responsibility, which shape discourses and practices related to HIV/AIDS. The authors argue that dominant narratives frame non-normative sexualities as a threat to moral and social order, leading to heightened criminalization of people living with HIV and the marginalization of pleasure as an aspect of sexual health. Drawing on qualitative research, including interviews with activists and analysis of prevention campaigns (e.g., the controversial "Sex in my City" campaign), the authors demonstrate how conservative sexual politics constrain the efforts of NGOs. They conclude that mass protests against homophobia and restrictive abortion laws may create opportunities for alternative, pleasure-centered visions of sexuality grounded in agency and affirmation.

results.title: Pianiści i pianistki polskie na estradach koncertowych Paryża w okresie międzywojennym : przegląd prasy muzycznej

abstracts.content: In the interwar period, the musical Paris attracted artists from around the world, including a large number of Polish musicians: singers, instrumentalists and conductors. The largest group were the pianists, who took advantage of the opportunity that the city offered. It was not easy to reach a wide audience, but the very possibility of performing in the French capital was exciting. An entire galaxy of distinguished artists passed through the Parisian concert halls, them, including the big-name stars such as Ignacy Jan Paderewski or Artur Rubinstein, as well as lesser-known pianists, such as Erwin Brynicki, Stanisław Niedzielski, Ryszard Byk and Louta Nouneberg. We find numerous instances of their concert performances in the local press: in journals and periodicals. This material allows us to look holistically at the Polish performers against the background of Parisian musical scene. The purpose of the paper is to present the general characteristics of this phenomenon, taking into account such aspects as: a chronicle of events, repertoire, critical reviews.

book.title: The legacy of the Wimbledon case : centenary of the first judgment of the Permanent Court of International Justice

results.title: Legal status of international and internal waterways

abstracts.content: The emblematic Wimbledon case decided by the Permanent Court of International Justice (PCIJ) in 1923 still provokes debate on multiple legal matters. This Chapter examines the contemporary international regime of waterways, tracing its inception to the Wimbledon judgment and exploring whether including a broader array of waterways in an international regime with analogous regulation can be justified. To address judicial and scholarly attempts to theorize the existence of a unified legal regime on international waterways, the author explains the notion of international waterways, the concept of canal internationalization, and the problem of objective legal regimes. Multiple examples bolster the legal analysis, especially regarding the three main interoceanic canals of Kiel, Suez, and Panama. In conclusion, the author states that even though the analyzed scenarios do not support the existence of a unified international regime of waterways, the Wimbledon judgment marked a starting point in the development of the common framework for them and acts as a cornerstone for the concept of the objective legal regime.

results.title: Philosophy across borders : perspectives from contemporary theory

book.title: Constitutionalization of politics in comparative perspective

results.title: Climate change policy from the perspective of the constitutionalization of politics : the context of the Fifth French Republic

abstracts.content: The chapter deals with climate change policy in France as an area which is increasingly subject to legal regulation at various levels. Due to the strategic and far-reaching initiatives aimed at climate protection being designed by political actors, this policy can be treated as a relatively new phenomenon that goes beyond traditional environmental protection policy and becomes part of so-called ecological democracy. Moreover, concrete policies aimed at protecting the earth against undesirable climate change are often the subject of political controversy. It is argued here that the abovementioned circumstances create a favorable context for the intensification of processes referred to as the constitutionalization of politics. New areas of political action need particularly strong argumentation. This can be provided by the constitution itself as a piece of legislation with which ordinary laws must comply. Hence, the scope of potential political choices referring to selected public policies may be constitutionally narrowed. In particular, the constitutional rights and freedoms of the individual, including the right to live in a clean natural environment, may become an important point of reference. In France such a constitutional document is the Charter for the Environment of 2004, which has become—as an element of the so-called bloc of constitutionality—part of the constitutional order itself. On the other hand, during the presidency of Emmanuel Macron, steps have been taken to constitutionalize protection against climate change as one of the basic constitutional principles. Such approach can be thought of as an attempt to secure a specific policy through a clearly defined and dynamically shaped constitutional axiology.

book.title: Recent advances in public sector management

results.title: An ambiguous relationship between public administration and AI

abstracts.content: This chapter is an attempt to present how artificial intelligence (AI) impacts public administration and the basic ethical challenges it brings to this environment. The introduction shows the main model of relation between public administration and AI and also gives the main questions that will guide all argumentations. The second section sets up the framework for further analysis and it explains the rudimental for the whole analysis term of public administration and AI. In the second section, the fields of the use of AI in public administration are shown, including the decision-making process and other forms of public services. The third is dedicated to ethical issues that are inextricably linked with administration and AI usage.

book.title: Bloomsbury handbook of North Korean cinema

results.title: Religion on the North Korean Screen : different approaches to christianity and buddhism in The Ch'oe Hak-sin family and We Met at Mt. Myohyang

abstracts.content: This first handbook on North Korean cinema contests the assumption that North Korean film is “unwatchable,” in terms of both quality and accessibility, refusing to reduce North Korean cinema to political propaganda and focusing on its aesthetic forms and cultural meanings. Since its founding in 1948, the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea (North Korea) has played diverse roles: a Cold War communist threat to the US, the other half of a divided nation to South Korea, an ally to the Soviet Union and China, one model for anti-colonialism to national liberation movements, an exotic political and cultural anomaly in the era of globalization. This handbook provides a solid and diverse foundation for the expanding scholarship on North Korean cinema. It is also a road map for connecting this field to broader issues in film and media studies: film history, affect and ideology, genre, and transnational cinema cultures. By connecting the worlds of North Korean cinema to broader questions in global cinema studies, this book explores the complexity of a national cinema too often reduced to a single image.

book.title: Relationships rights and legal pluralism : the inadequacy of marriage laws in Europe

results.title: Article 12 of the ECHR : what are the implications of the right to marry for relationship diversity?

abstracts.content:
The chapter focuses on Article 12 of the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) and its response to the observed variety of relationship designs. The basic assumption is that human rights should commit to value pluralism and embrace social diversity instead of suppressing it. However, Article 12 promotes a very homogeneous vision of family life based on heteronormativity and does not increase the number of people who can live in harmony with themselves, their needs, and values. Instead, it perpetuates an oppressive status quo.

This is because the European Court of Human Rights (ECtHR) interpretation of the right to marry is very narrow and applies only to heterosexual and monogamous marriages. The ECtHR also uses a wide margin of appreciation to respect the culture and tradition of each society, consequently, supporting a very particular way of life. Moreover, the adjudication focuses on the institution of marriage and its preservation rather than on the actual bond between people. Finally, the mere existence of the right to marry in ECHR has a strong symbolic meaning that sends a clear message about what kind of relationship is considered the most desirable.
